newsitem.title: MEXICO: Clinton leaves Mexico for Costa Rica.
newsitem.headline: Clinton leaves Mexico for Costa Rica.

text.p: President Bill Clinton left Mexico on Wednesday evening for Costa Rica, where he will attend a meeting with Central American leaders.
Ending a three-day visit, live television pictures showed Clinton departed Mexico City at 8:25 p.m. local time (9:25 p.m. EDT), on Air Force One for the 2 1/2 hour flight south to Costa Rica.
Clinton called for an expansion of free trade across the Americas earlier in a speech to businessmen in Mexico City.

He then flew to the picturesque colonial city of Tlaxcala, 75 miles (120 km) east of Mexico City, and visited Mexico's famous pre-Columbian pyramids at Teotihuacan before returning to the capital for a courtesy call to the U.S. embassy.
Clinton and Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo agreed on Tuesday to intensify the war on drugs and cooperate on border migration problems.
After sailing smoothly through the potentially rocky trip to Mexico, Clinton faces more diplomatic challenges in Central America, where he will meet regional leaders at a summit on Thursday.
